abstract: Killing of Kenneth Chamberlain Sr, former Marine and corrections officer who was black and mentally ill, by White Plains police officers in 2011 will go to trial, and court will assess claims of assault and battery as well as excessive force; Chamberlain's death preceded string of high-profile police shootings, but trial will take place in environment in which Black Lives Matter movement has called attention to how police officers handle African-American communities.
lead_paragraph: The City of White Plains, a New York suburb, is facing a $21 million lawsuit by the family of Kenneth Chamberlain Sr., a former Marine fatally shot by the police in his apartment.
snippet: The City of White Plains, a New York suburb, is facing a $21 million lawsuit by the family of Kenneth Chamberlain Sr., a former Marine fatally shot by the police in his apartment....

headline.main: Police Killing of Mentally Ill Black Man Is, 5 Years Later, Headed to Trial
headline.print_headline: White Plains Police Killing Goes to Trial in Newly Charged Environment
